title: Dashboard for orthostatic test data
text: toolkit sports physiology analysis, providing: Orthostatic Test Processing - Full pipeline FIT files readiness scores Neural Recovery Metrics - BioForce-inspired composite scoring BJJ-Specific Analytics - Grappling-specific training recommendations Automated Reporting - Daily PDF/HTML reports training guidance Dashboard Visualization - Interactive trend monitoring

title: Dashboard for orthostatic test data
text: Optimized Processing Multi-threaded FIT file analysis using furrr BioForce HRV methodology Firstbeat Technologies recovery analysis European Journal Applied Physiology standards Advanced Caching Version-aware cache invalidation automatic reprocessing Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (positional sparring load) Strength training (volume/intensity ratios) Endurance sports (HR recovery profiles)

title: Dashboard for orthostatic test data
code: # Process FIT files with parallel execution metrics <- process_fit_directory(   "path/to/fit/files",   filter_factor = 0.175,  # Adaptive outlier rejection   cache_file = "hrv_cache.csv" )  # Generate daily readiness report report <- generate_daily_report(metrics) cat(report)  # Create dashboard dashboard <- plot_hrv_dashboard(metrics) dashboard

title: Analyze HRV readiness status — analyze_readiness
text: function evaluates athlete's readiness training based HRV metrics. compares current day metrics 7-day rolling baseline provides training status along specific recommendations.

title: Analyze HRV readiness status — analyze_readiness
text: current_metrics dataframe containing current day's HRV metrics. Must contain exactly one row. include: laying_rmssd (numeric): Current day's RMSSD laying position laying_resting_hr (numeric): Current day's resting heart rate orthostatic_rise (numeric): Current day's orthostatic response baseline_metrics dataframe containing previous 7 days' HRV metrics. include: laying_rmssd (numeric): Historical RMSSD values baseline calculation laying_resting_hr (numeric): Historical resting heart rate values orthostatic_rise (numeric): Historical orthostatic response values

title: Analyze HRV readiness status — analyze_readiness
text: list containing: status (character): Training status ("FRESH", "NORMAL", "CAUTION", "WARNING") recommendations (list): Training recommendations BJJ, strength, cardio flags (list): Additional warning flags high fatigue, poor recovery, overreaching risk metrics (list): Baseline values deviation calculations

title: Cache Definition — cache_definition
text: Defines structure cache data. function creates tibble containing necessary columns storing HRV metrics.

title: Cache Definition — cache_definition
text: tibble columns: source_file (character): Path source FIT file date (character): Date measurement week (numeric): Week number time_of_day (character): Time day ("Morning" "Evening") laying_rmssd (numeric): RMSSD laying position laying_sdnn (numeric): SDNN laying position laying_hr (numeric): Mean heart rate laying position laying_resting_hr (numeric): Resting heart rate standing_rmssd (numeric): RMSSD standing position standing_sdnn (numeric): SDNN standing position standing_hr (numeric): Mean heart rate standing position standing_max_hr (numeric): Maximum heart rate standing package_version (character): Version package RR_filter (numeric): Filter factor used processing activity (character): Type activity

text: Adds moving averages relative changes HRV data

title: Calculate all moving averages — calculate_moving_averages
text: data Dataframe HRV measurements window_size Number days moving average min_fraction Minimum fraction data required

title: Calculate all moving averages — calculate_moving_averages
text: Dataframe added moving averages

what: Calculate full neural recovery score based on BioForce HRV methodology — calculate_neural_recovery
title: Calculate full neural recovery score based on BioForce HRV methodology — calculate_neural_recovery
text: function calculates comprehensive neural recovery score combining multiple HRV metrics. score based following components: RMSSD (parasympathetic recovery) Orthostatic response (autonomic balance) Heart rate recovery (recovery capacity)

title: Calculate full neural recovery score based on BioForce HRV methodology — calculate_neural_recovery
Calculate full neural recovery score based on BioForce HRV methodology — calculate_neural_recovery
text: data Dataframe containing HRV measurements. include: laying_rmssd (numeric): RMSSD laying position laying_resting_hr (numeric): Resting heart rate rmssd_ma (numeric): Moving average RMSSD (added calculate_moving_averages) standing_hr (numeric): Heart rate standing position hrr_60s (numeric): Heart rate recovery 60 seconds window_size Number days use calculating moving averages (default: 7). Used establish baseline values comparison. Must positive integer.

title: Calculate full neural recovery score based on BioForce HRV methodology — calculate_neural_recovery
text: Dataframe added columns: rmssd_score (numeric): Score based RMSSD ratio (0-40 points) ortho_score (numeric): Score based orthostatic response (0-30 points) hrr_score (numeric): Score based heart rate recovery (0-30 points) neural_recovery_score (numeric): Combined total score (0-100) recovery_status (character): Classification based total score

title: Calculate resting heart rate — calculate_resting_hr
text: Estimates resting heart rate using various methods

title: Calculate resting heart rate — calculate_resting_hr
text: hr_data Vector heart rate values method Calculation method use stability_threshold Allowable HR variation window_size Window size samples

title: Calculate resting heart rate — calculate_resting_hr
text: Numeric resting heart rate value

title: Calculate rolling mean — calculate_robust_ma
text: Computes rolling mean minimum data requirements

title: Calculate rolling mean — calculate_robust_ma
text: x Numeric vector window Window size min_fraction Minimum fraction non-NA values required

title: Calculate rolling mean — calculate_robust_ma
text: Numeric vector rolling means

what: Helper function to calculate trend direction — calculate_trend_direction
title: Helper function to calculate trend direction — calculate_trend_direction
text: Determines direction trends HRV metrics using linear regression. function fits linear model values categorizes slope descriptive trend categories.

title: Helper function to calculate trend direction — calculate_trend_direction
Helper function to calculate trend direction — calculate_trend_direction
text: values Numeric vector values analyze trend. contain least 2 values.

title: Helper function to calculate trend direction — calculate_trend_direction
text: Character string describing trend direction magnitude: "Stable" (abs(slope) < 0.1) "Slight Increase" (0.1 <= slope <= 0.5) "Strong Increase" (slope > 0.5) "Slight Decrease" (-0.5 <= slope < -0.1) "Strong Decrease" (slope < -0.5)

title: Create empty result row — create_empty_result
text: Helper function create empty result row NA values

title: Create empty result row — create_empty_result
text: file_path Source file path date Date measurement week Week number time_of_day Time day filter_factor RR filter factor used

title: Create empty result row — create_empty_result
text: Tibble NA values

what: Extract RR intervals from FIT file — extract_rr_data
title: Extract RR intervals from FIT file — extract_rr_data
text: Extracts heart rate variability data FIT files analyzing RR intervals laying standing positions. Implements robust filtering maintain data quality properly handle phase transitions.

title: Extract RR intervals from FIT file — extract_rr_data
code: extract_rr_data(   fit_object,   filter_factor = 0.15,   laying_time = 180,   standing_time = 180,   transition_buffer = 20 )

title: Extract RR intervals from FIT file — extract_rr_data
text: fit_object FITfileR object containing FIT file data filter_factor Numeric value (0-1) filtering outliers. Higher values allow variation successive intervals laying_time Duration seconds laying position (default: 180) standing_time Duration seconds standing position (default: 180) transition_buffer Time seconds exclude around position change (default: 5)

title: Extract RR intervals from FIT file — extract_rr_data
text: List containing: laying Numeric vector RR intervals laying position (seconds) standing Numeric vector RR intervals standing position (seconds)

what: Extract session metadata from FIT object — extract_session_data
title: Extract session metadata from FIT object — extract_session_data
text: Extracts processes session-related metadata FIT file object, including date, week number, time day classification.

title: Extract session metadata from FIT object — extract_session_data
Extract session metadata from FIT object — extract_session_data
text: fit_object object class FitFile

title: Extract session metadata from FIT object — extract_session_data
text: list containing: date (Date): session date week (numeric): Week number year time_of_day (character): Classification either "Morning" (4-13h) "Evening"

title: Extract session metadata from FIT object — extract_session_data
text: Time day classified "Morning" measurements taken 04:00 13:00, "Evening" otherwise. classification particularly relevant HRV measurements can vary significantly morning evening readings.

title: Generate daily HRV report — generate_daily_report
text: Creates formatted text report summarizing current HRV status, metrics, recommendations.

title: Generate daily HRV report — generate_daily_report
text: data dataframe containing HRV metrics least 8 consecutive days (current day plus 7-day baseline). include: date (Date): Measurement dates laying_rmssd (numeric): RMSSD laying position laying_resting_hr (numeric): Resting heart rate orthostatic_rise (numeric): Orthostatic response

title: Generate daily HRV report — generate_daily_report
text: formatted character string containing HRV report sections: Date status header Current metrics baseline comparisons Training recommendations BJJ, strength, cardio Warning flags present 7-day trend analysis RMSSD heart rate

what: Plot HRV summaries for a single orthostatic test fit file. — hrv_plot
title: Plot HRV summaries for a single orthostatic test fit file. — hrv_plot
text: Creates visualization heart rate variability (HRV) data FIT file. plot can display either heart rate (HR) RR interval data, annotations showing key metrics.

title: Plot HRV summaries for a single orthostatic test fit file. — hrv_plot
Plot HRV summaries for a single orthostatic test fit file. — hrv_plot
text: file_path Path FIT file process base Character indicating type data plot: "HR": Heart rate data "RR": RR interval data filter_factor Numeric value used filter RR intervals filter_factor times smaller larger previous value. Helps remove suspected false readings. Default: 0.175

title: Plot HRV summaries for a single orthostatic test fit file. — hrv_plot
text: ggplot2 plot object

what: hrvester: Simple Heart Rate Variability Analysis — hrvester-package
title: hrvester: Simple Heart Rate Variability Analysis — hrvester-package
text: Provides tools analyzing Heart Rate Variability (HRV) FIT files. Focuses orthostatic test analysis (laying standing measurements).

title: hrvester: Simple Heart Rate Variability Analysis — hrvester-package
text: process_fit_directory(): Process multiple FIT files caching process_fit_file(): Process single FIT file plot_hrv_trend(): Create trend plots HRV metrics

text: Maintainer: Maximilian Scholz dev.scholz@mailbox.org

text: Generates neural recovery score plot specifically tailored Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu athletes. score combines: RMSSD relative 7-day average Orthostatic response

title: Plot BJJ-specific recovery metrics — plot_bjj_metrics
text: data data frame containing HRV metrics columns: date: Date measurement laying_rmssd: RMSSD laying position rmssd_ma: 7-day moving average RMSSD standing_hr: Standing heart rate laying_hr: Laying heart rate

title: Plot BJJ-specific recovery metrics — plot_bjj_metrics

title: Create comprehensive HRV dashboard — plot_hrv_dashboard

title: Create weekly summary heatmap — plot_weekly_heatmap
text: Generates heatmap showing weekly recovery status based RMSSD changes. Status categories : Fresh: RMSSD change > 5% Normal: RMSSD change -5% 5% Caution: RMSSD change -10% -5% Warning: RMSSD change < -10%

title: Create weekly summary heatmap — plot_weekly_heatmap
text: data data frame containing HRV metrics columns: method Either neural_recovery_score rmssd_change date: Date measurement rmssd_change: Percentage change RMSSD

title: Create weekly summary heatmap — plot_weekly_heatmap
text: ggplot2 heatmap object

what: Process directory of FIT files with caching — process_fit_directory

title: Process directory of FIT files with caching — process_fit_directory
